titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Book-of-the-Month Club Records
titlestmt.author: by Christopher Geissler, Tom Hyry, and Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday January 23, 2019 at 04:21

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection consists of proofs and "first reader reports" that document a component of the selection process for titles that became Book-of-the-Month Club selections. The proofs are pre-publication copies of manuscripts, used by Book-of-the-Month Club judges to select titles. The reports comprise reviews by in-house editors and outside readers of manuscripts under consideration for publication. They were written by a wide variety of individuals including Rosemary Benet, Basil Davenport, Elizabeth Wynne Easton, Roger Pippett, John Sherry, Russell Thacher, Ralph Thompson, and Leon Wilson.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Book-of-the-Month Club, circa 1978 and 2000.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Book-of-the-Month Club Records is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Book-of-the-Month Club Records. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection includes materials that previously used the call numbers Za BOMC, Uncat MSS 170, and Uncat MSS 1023.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The Book-of-the-Month Club (BOMC) was founded in 1926 by Harry Scherman (1887-1969) in partnership with Maxwell Sackheim (1890-1982) and Robert K. Haas (1890-1964). Created to satisfy a perceived demand for quality literature that could not be met outside of urban centers, it was one of a number of direct-mail clubs developed in the 1920s, including the Literary Guild and Dollar Book Club. The BOMC went public in 1947, though the Scherman family maintained a controlling interest until sale of their shares in 1977 to Time Inc.

The BOMC sold new releases to its membership through recommendations published in a monthly catalog. Pre-publication manuscripts were submitted to the BOMC for review and were considered through a tiered system of in-house and outside editors culminating in an editorial board, referred to as judges in BOMC literature, that met monthly to consider vetted submissions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of proofs and "first reader reports" that document a component of the selection process for titles that became Book-of-the-Month Club recommendations. The proofs are pre-publication copies of manuscripts, used by Book-of-the-Month Club judges to select titles. They can be located in Series I and Series III.

The reports comprise reviews by in-house editors and outside readers of manuscripts under consideration for publication. They were written by a wide variety of individuals including Rosemary Benet, Basil Davenport, Elizabeth Wynne Easton, Roger Pippett, John Sherry, Russell Thacher, Ralph Thompson, and Leon Wilson.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three series: I. Manuscripts, circa 1959-1978. II. First-reader Reports, circa 1946-1962. III. Additional Manuscripts (July 2000 Acquisition), circa 1951-1979.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series consists of pre-publication copies, mostly galley proofs, of manuscripts submitted to the Book-of-the-Month Club to be considered for selection as a featured title. The manuscripts were most likely prepared and distributed for judges and many have stickers affixed, designating the copy as an "A" book. Although these galleys often contain editorial notes in the reproduction, they are generally unmarked by the readers at the Book-of-the-Month Club.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: Additional titles are listed in Series III, which consists of the July 2000 acquisition of this collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged alphabetically by author.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The First Reader Reports consist of typescript reviews of manuscripts, written by a combination of in-house editors and outside readers. The reports helped the Book-of-the-Month Club select titles from among manuscripts submitted by publishers and individuals. The reports are typed on a given form stipulating the institutional expectations for the reports, with specific questions guiding the reader to determine whether or not the given manuscript should be considered by the judges at the monthly meetings.

The reports were written by a wide variety of reviewers, including Rosemary Benet, Basil Davenport, Elizabeth Wynne Easton, Roger Pippett, John Sherry, Russell Thacher, Ralph Thompson, and Leon Wilson.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged loosely chronologically, with two pre-designated categories, "African diaspora history and literature" and "American literature" filed at the beginning. Reviews of books in these topics are also included among the chronologically arranged materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series consists of bound and galley proofs of works published by the club.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: Additional manuscripts can be found in Series I.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged alphabetically by author.
